args: There's nary a soul to be found in this city.\nNevin's bad feeling was right on the mark.
(These incidents with the demons being\nrestored are clearly the work of Basileus,\nbut what is his end goal?)
A survivor! Are you all right? Is there\nanyone else alive around here?
Sorry, you're mumbling. What did you say?
SHUT UP AND STOP ASKING\nSO MANY QUESTIONS!
Look at all this miasma... Are you being\ncontrolled by a demon?!
I told you to shut up! I was finally alone,\nand now you had to show up uninvited\nto my damned city!
Yeah. Mine. My city, all for me. I just want\nto live here in silence and quiet without\nanyone else around to bother me.
Dealing with other people is so irritating.\nPeople are born alone and die alone,\nso being around them is pointless.
That's why I made everyone leave—and it\nwas perfectly quiet and satisfying until\nYOU showed up!
What? There's no way the people of the\ncity would agree to that. What did you do\nto them?
Shut up! Shut up, shut up, SHUT UP!\nStay away from me! I don't trust you!\nI don't trust anyone! AAAAAAH!
Gah! I won't be able to talk to her unless\nI get rid of this miasma... Haaah!

Grant me now the glory of thy name, that
I may offer thy salvation unto the people
of the world and grant succor unto the
consecrated.
You should be back to normal now—\nand I'm sorry to rush things, but I need\nyou to explain what happened here.
What happened here? Oh... No, please!\nI didn't mean to do it!
Easy there. Just talk to me.
I...did those things? I did them to the old\nman from the neighborhood, and the lady\nfrom the store and...and Mom and Dad?!
Well, that's disgusting. This is why I can't\nstand your frail, lesser species.
Uriel?! ...No, you're but a mimicry of Uriel\nin which a demon was sealed!
And you're the apostle sworn to Uriel with\na Sigil. Well now, aren't you naughty,\ndriving a believer into such a broken state!
Just look at how miserable she is.\nThe guilt of having killed the people of\nher city threatens to crush her entirely.
No... No, no, no, no, no...\nI killed them... I killed EVERYONE!\nThis wasn't what I wanted!
She's useless now—and it's your fault.
I mean, duh? Maybe you were trying to\nsave her, but this is what you got.\nInstead of helping, you drove her mad.
Humanity is a pathetic race. All you do is\nhold each other back.
This isn't because of humanity, demon.\nIt's because of your miasma.
Trying to blame it on me? What a joke.\nAll I've done is open the eyes of your\npathetic species.
My miasma robs people of their bonds...\nBut so what? The strong have no need for\nsuch things in the first place.
That girl sitting pathetically in the dirt is\nthere because of her own weakness.\nDon't go blaming that on others.
People can't live a life of solitude and\nabandonment. If you choose to call that\nweakness, that's on you.
But even if it is a weakness, it drives us\nto join together and become stronger by\nrising above it!
Heh. Are you truly intending to fight me\nwith that useless trash burdening you?

Throw her away so she doesn't hold you
down! And then admit that bonds with
others are no more than shackles around
your throat!
You pass, Faris. You did well to protect\nthe girl from that fallen angel.
What are all of you doing here?!
I heard the gist of things from Nevin and\nUriel, and I want to help.
Ugh, you invited your friends? It's just like\nyou weaklings to herd together like beasts\nat the water hole.

Tell me, do you feel safe nestled with your
friends? Why can't you see how pointless
it is to be surrounded by other weaklings
in the face of one who is truly mighty?

You fools are nothing more than flies
buzzing in my ear. The weak should
embrace nature and obey the strong—
such as myself.
Oh, you seem plenty strong, friend.
But that doesn't mean you get a\npassing grade.

If you believe the weak should obey the
strong, what do you do when someone
stronger shows up? Obey them without
complaint? I very much doubt it.
The superior person changes with the\ncircumstances. So even if you dominate\nothers, it is but a temporary situation.
Then what do you obey? And by what\nmeans do you make OTHERS obey?
Order. It is the ideology of those who seek\nwhat is right. And the roots of that notion\nare the very bonds you decry as shackles.

Precisely because we are weak, we have
spent an extraordinarily long time building
order upon a foundation of bonds.
And that order is our firm stronghold.

Do you understand this, fallen angel?
None will obey you so long as you curse
the bonds and relationships possessed
by the weak.
Psh. Sophistry from an angel dragged\ndown by humanity.

Fine then. I'll prove it to ya.
You're about to see just how meaningless
the ＂order＂ you cling to is in the face of
strength!
I am the apostle Faris, one hand of the\nGoddess, and I shall administer Her will!
You rejects need to shut up\nand do what I tell you!
